title: Ford pausing construction of Michigan battery plant amid contract talks with auto workers union
description: Construction paused until Ford is sure it can run the factory competitively.

title: Video shows California deputy slamming 16-year-old girl to the ground
description: A video shows a Southern California sheriff’s deputy slamming a teenage girl to the ground during a fight outside a Friday night high school football game

title: Manslaughter charges thrown out in Michigan prisoner's death
description: A judge has dismissed charges against six people in the death of a Michigan prisoner who lost 50 pounds over two weeks and died of dehydration while being restrained

title: US military captures key Islamic State militant during helicopter raid in Syria
description: The U.S. military says it has captured an operator for the Islamic State extremist group during a helicopter raid in northern Syria

title: Firefighter's 3-year-old son struck, killed at memorial walk for slain firefighters
description: Authorities say the 3-year-old son of a firefighter was struck and killed in Delaware over the weekend shortly before a memorial walk was to begin to honor three firefighters killed in a blaze seven years ago

title: Uber Eats to accept SNAP benefits for groceries following announcement from Instacart
description: Grocers and shoppers who rely on the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, or SNAP, will soon be able to access benefits using more online grocery services.

title: 3rd person arrested in fentanyl day care case, search continues for owner's husband
description: A third person has been arrested in connection with the New York City day care drug operation that resulted in the death of a 1-year-old boy.

title: 17-year-old allegedly shoots, kills 3 other teens
description: A South Carolina community is reeling in the wake of a shooting that killed three teenagers and injured a fourth.

title: 8 hospitalized after JetBlue flight experiences 'sudden severe turbulence'
description: 8 hospitalized after JetBlue flight experiences "sudden severe turbulence"

title: Raiders' Garoppolo is in concussion protocol, putting his start for game in question
description: Las Vegas Raiders quarterback Jimmy Garoppolo is in concussion protocol

title: Journalist killed in attack aimed at police in northern Mexico border town
description: A journalist who ran a community Facebook news page has been killed in the northern Mexico border town of San Luis Rio Colorado, when he was apparently caught in the cross-fire of an attack aimed at police

title: Large explosion as thousands of ethnic Armenians flee disputed enclave
description: Armenian authorities say they are prepared for tens of thousands of families to flee.

title: Megan Rapinoe plays final US Women's National Team game
description: Team USA scored a victory against South Africa in Rapinoe's final game.

title: Bill would criminalize 'extremely harmful' online 'deepfakes’
description: Deepfake legislation from Rep. Yvette Clarke seeks to protect individuals nationwide from being misrepresented by certain kinds of digital content

title: What you need to know about California's CARE Court program
description: California's new CARE Court program to help those with serous, untreated mental health issues starts next month -- and is mired in controversy. Here's what to know.

title: Sen. Bob Menendez, facing corruption charges, rebuffs calls for his resignation
description: Sen. Bob Menendez on Monday delivered his first public remarks after being indicted on corruption charges.

title: Driver pleads not guilty in Vermont crash that killed actor Treat Williams
description: A Vermont driver has pleaded not guilty to a charge in the June crash that killed actor Treat Williams

title: FDA skeptical of experimental ALS treatment pushed by patient advocates
description: The Food and Drug Administration meets this week to consider a much-debated treatment for Lou Gehrig’s disease

title: Biden administration announces $1.4 billion to improve rail safety and boost capacity
description: The Biden administration has awarded $1.4 billion to projects improving railway safety and boosting rail capacity

title: Monday night's $785M Powerball jackpot is 9th largest lottery prize
description: The ninth-largest lottery jackpot will be on the line when numbers are drawn for a $785 million Powerball prize

title: Former UK nurse will be retried on charge she tried to murder baby girl at hospital
description: A former neonatal nurse who was sentenced to life in prison for the murder of seven babies in her care and trying to kill six others at a U.K. hospital will face a retrial on a charge of attempting to murder a newborn baby girl

title: Steelers' team plane makes emergency landing in Kansas City
description: The Pittsburgh Steelers’ charter flight home following a Sunday night win in Las Vegas made an emergency landing in Kansas City early Monday

title: Film legend Sophia Loren has successful surgery after fracturing a leg in a fall
description: The Italian actor is recovering from successful surgery.

title: London's armed officers protest murder charge for colleague
description: The head of London’s police force is calling for increased legal protections for officers who use force in the line of duty after more than 100 officers refused to carry guns to protest murder charges filed against one of their colleagues

title: Macron to unveil latest plan for meeting climate-related goals in the coming years
description: President Emmanuel Macron is preparing to reveal how France plans to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and meet the country’s climate-related commitments within the next seven years

title: 'Just in shock': Dock worker assaulted in Alabama brawl speaks out in 'GMA' exclusive
description: After a brawl at Riverfront Park in Montgomery, Alabama went viral, Dameion Pickett, who was at the center of the incident, is speaking out in an interview with "GMA."

title: US border agency chief meets with authorities in Mexico over migrant surge
description: Acting CBP Commissioner Troy Miller traveled to Ciudad Juarez, Mexico, on Friday, where he met with Mexican officials and railway industry leaders.

title: WATCH:  Riders get stuck upside down on broken fairground ride
description: Riders at a Canadian amusement park got stuck upside down on a ride for nearly 30 minutes on Saturday.

title: A statue of late cardinal accused of abuse removed from outside a German cathedral
description: A statue of a deceased German cardinal has been removed from its perch outside Essen Cathedral in western Germany, days after allegations of sexual abuse decades ago became public

title: On the run for decades, convicted Mafia boss Messina Denaro dies in hospital
description: Italian prosecutors say that Matteo Messina Denaro, a convicted mastermind of some of the Sicilian Mafia’s most heinous slayings, has died in a hospital prison ward, months after being captured

title: Molotov cocktails tossed at Cuban Embassy in Washington, minister says
description: The Cuban embassy staff "suffered no harm," and "details are being worked out," Foreign Affairs Minister Bruno Rodríguez Parrilla said.

title: Megan Rapinoe gets triumphant send-off as United States beats South Africa 2-0
description: Megan Rapinoe got a triumphant send-off, and the United States beat South Africa 2-0

title: North Korea calls South's leader a 'guy with a trash-like brain' as it slams his UN speech
description: North Korea calls South Korean president “a guy with a trash-like brain."

title: Hollywood writers reach 'tentative' deal with studios, end monthslong strike
description: The strike spanned 146 days and brought pickets to productions nationwide.

title: Kidnapped teen rescued from Southern California motel room after 4 days of being held hostage
description: He was held hostage for four days by captors who demanded a $500,000 ransom.
